title: Towards future-safe emacs.d
description: I've helped make my Emacs configurations more maintainable by creating a structured approach to testing, linting and compilation. By using eldev for project management, straight.el for packages, and organizing code into init/lib/config files with proper autoloads, I've achieved both quick startup and robust development. The solution includes proper byte compilation, linting with elisp-lint, and testing with buttercup - all while maintaining performance. I've shared the complete setup including Makefiles and helper scripts to automate the process.
